channel.title: Automation on Data Automation
channel.description: Recent content in Automation on Data Automation

item.title: Setting up Metabase and PostgreSQL with Docker
item.description: How to built a simple service architecture, easy to maintain and portable using Docker? Throughout this post, you’ll discover how to do that integrating a PostgreSQL database with Metabase

item.title: RD Station and Google Sheets Part 2 - Moving to AWS
item.description: We saw before on this blog how to send leads from RD Station to a spreadsheet automatically. Now we will see how to send these same leads to a database hosted on AWS

item.title: RD Station and Google Sheets: automatically exporting leads to spreadsheets
item.description: Get to know how to automatically send leads to Google Sheets from RD Station, a marketing automation software

item.title: APIs and grocery carts
item.description: What is an API and what it is for? This post will introduce it without using technical language.

item.title: Google Apps Script with OAuth2
item.description: Google Apps Script is packed with many features to enhance other Google products. One of these features allows Google apps to connect with third party services. This feature will be presented throughout this post, focusing on APIs that authenticate using OAuth2 protocol.

item.title: The basics of APIs
item.description: APIs are very useful to automate processes and personalize workflows. From a technical standpoint, they contribute for developing distributed applications. Knowing APIs is vital to create applications able to communicate with the outside world.

item.title: An overview of Google Apps Script
item.description: In a previous post I briefly presented Google Apps Script, a tool capable of enhancing the default features of any Google apps. In this post, I will make its proper introduction and show how to use it to automate data collection and treatment tasks.

item.title: Creating automated reports through APIs
item.description: Recently I had to build a repository with data that would feed some reports. The sources that would need to be ingested were scattered at least across 6 different systems and reunite all that information weekly was time consuming. I’ve figured out a way to make that process somewhat more efficient.
